column20: title
Do you or would you have pain with vigorous activities such as running, lifting heavy objects or participating in strenuous sports?
Do you or would you have pain with moderate activities such as moving a heavy table, pushing a vacuum cleaner, bowling or playing golf?
Do you or would you have pain with lifting or carrying groceries?
Do you or would you have pain with climbing more than one flight of stairs?
Do you or would you have pain with climbing only a few steps?
Do you or would you have pain walking more than one block?
Do you or would you have pain walking one block or less?
Do you have pain with bathing or dressing?
Have you cut down the amount of time you spend on work or doing activities because of pain?
Have you been accomplishing less than you would like because of pain?
Have you limited the kind of work or other activities you do because of pain?
Does the work or activities you do require extra effort because of pain?
Do you have trouble sleeping because of pain?
Does pain prevent you from attending religious activities?
Does pain prevent you from enjoying any other social or recreational activities (other than religious services)?
Does or would pain prevent you from traveling or using standard transportation?
Does pain make you feel fatigued or tired?
Do you have to rely on family members or friends for help because of pain?
On a scale of zero to ten, with zero meaning no pain, with ten being the worst pain you can imagine, how severe is your pain today?
In the last seven days, on a scale of zero to ten, with zero meaning no pain, with ten being the worst pain you can imagine, how severe has your pain been on average?
Do you have pain that never completely goes away?
Do you have pain every day?
Do you have pain several times a week?
Over the last seven days, has pain caused you to feel sad or depressed?
